## Fires by different landcover characteristics
install.packages("plotly")
library("plotly") # load
utahfires <- read.csv('C:/Users/BelmontLab/Documents/Alec/Research/Site_Selection/Graph/Cluster-Analysis.csv', stringsAsFactors = F)
xval=utahfires$`PerModHigh`
yval=utahfires$`Per_Con`
zval=utahfires$`TwoThreepercent`
fig <- plot_ly(x =xval, y=yval, z=zval, color= utahfires$`Class`, colors = c('#BF382A', '#0C4B8E','#4AC6B7', '#1972A4', '#965F8A', '#FF7070', '#C61951'), 
               size =utahfires$`Acres`,text=utahfires$`Fire_Name`,
               marker = list(symbol = 'circle', sizemode = 'diameter'), sizes = c(5, 50))
                                                                            
fig <- fig %>% layout(scene = list(xaxis = list(title = '% Moderate/High Severity'),
                                   yaxis = list(title = '% Conifer'),
                                   zaxis = list(title = '% Slope>23?')))
fig
